content: sts k2tog row 70 k as charted row 71-77 ssk k as charted to last 2 sts of top sts k2tog ssk k to last 2 sts k2tog row 78 k top sts as charted ssk k to end left row 66 ssk k to last 2 sts of palm sts k2tog ssk k as charted to last 2 sts of top sts k2tog row 67 k as charted row 68 k as charted row 69 ssk k to last 2 sts of palm sts k2tog ssk k as charted to last 2 sts of top sts k2tog row 70 k as charted row 71-77 ssk k to last 2 sts of palm sts k2tog ssk k as charted to last 2 sts of top sts k2tog row 78 ssk k as charted all sizes cut your yarn leaving a long tail and close the top of the mitten using kitchener stitch you will need to pull the yarn through two palm sts for every top st thumb the thumb on both mittens is worked the same way using larger needles pick up and knit the 14 held stitches pick up and knit 2 2 3 3 stitches in the gap between the thumb and the mitten pm for bor pick up and knit another 2 2 3 3 stitches 18 18 20 20 sts k to the end of the round k 8 8 9 9 rounds k2tog k to last 3sts ssk k1 repeat last round until 8sts remaining 10 10 12 12 decrease rounds total cut yarn leaving a long tai and close top of thumb using kitchener stitch converting the mittens if you placed scrap yarn to convert your mittens follow the instructions below if not skip them and head to finishing instead the instructions are the same for both mittens feel free to change pattern size as needed - i have quite chonky fingers so changed from knitting size two to size three for a better fit using smaller needles pick up the 18 20 22 24 sts above the contrasting yarn using another needle do the same for the 18 20 22 24 sts below the contrasting yarn 36 40 44 48 sts total remove the contrasting yarn leaving a hole between your needles top ribbing leave a long tail when joining the yarn row 1 using the sts on the top needle *k1tbl p1* to the end of the row row 2 *k1 p1tbl* repeat row 1 & 2 2 more times 6 row total then bind off i recommend using a stretchier bind off as the material will need to stretch fingers using a smaller needle pick up and knit 18 20 22 24 sts from the ws inside of the mitten - the back of the top sts this may be difficult due to the cable pattern so don t be afraid to cast on a few stitches in places where you can t pick one up knit the rs stitches
